page.title: 07BELTON HOUSE and PARK
page.content: The estate had remained in the hands of the Brownlow family from 1620 until 1983 when the trust purchased the house and part of the grounds for the people of this country. Elegant and symmetrical the house is a living tribute to the past and its thousands of annual visitors a sure sign that 20th C Britain remembers its roots. The interior of the house is equally attractive and interesting. A fine marble hall leading up and out to a host of splendidly furnished rooms many designed by famous architects like Sir Christopher Wren and furnished and furnished by past specialists like Grinling Gibbons. Many famous visitors, past and present, royal, political, and social have stayed in the house. Now it truly belongs to the people.
